citations:
Learned Counsel for the accused petitioners placed reliance on 
Dolat Ram v. State of Haryana
AIR 1987 SC 737

In 
Samunder Singh v. State of Rajasthan
Babu Singh v. State of U
Ram Gopal v. The State of Rajasthan

Lordships of the Supreme Court were considering the factors that heavily tipped the scales of justice in favour of release of accused on bail pending the decision of his appeal and observations made in 
Kashmira Singh v. State of Punjab
This Court in Sahabuddin Meb v. Shiv Lal and Ors

Learned Counsel for the complainant refuted this argument by placing reliance on 
Pratap v. State of U

Ratio o 
Hajuri v. Brundaban

C Placing reliance on 
Thakur Ram v. State of Bihar

I do not find any merit in the submission of learned Counsel for the petitioners in view of ratio propounded in 
Rathinam v. State

Judges of the Supreme Court in 
Pokar Ram v. State of Rajasthan
AIR 1985 SC 969

In 
Ram Gopal v. The State of Rajasthan
Hari Bhagwan Bansal v. State of Rajasthan

Full Bench of Madhya Bharat High Court in the case of 
Kamal Chand v. Amar Chand

Their Lordships of the Supreme Court in 
Bimla Devi v. State of Bihar
AIR 1966 SC 911

Their Lordships of Supreme Court in Council for 
Indian School Certificate Examination v. Isha Mittal

Court in the case of 
Ram Gopal v. State of Rajasthan
